config_description: GC Pauses greater than gc_warn_threshold_in_ms will be logged at WARN level Adjust the threshold based on your application throughput requirement. Setting to 0 will deactivate the feature.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' is used to set a threshold for garbage collection pauses. If the garbage collection pause exceeds this threshold, a log message will be generated at the WARN level. The code snippet provided initializes a GCInspector object which sets up the monitoring of garbage collection.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration depends on the garbage collection behavior of the system. If the garbage collection pauses exceed the threshold set by 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms', a log message will be generated at the WARN level. The frequency of this triggering will depend on how often garbage collection pauses exceed the threshold.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration option on the system is that it allows developers to monitor and log garbage collection pauses that exceed a certain threshold. This can help in identifying performance issues related to garbage collection and can provide insights into the behavior of the system under different workloads.
